title: Arrest of Major Cartel Leaders in Coahuila
name: Arrest of Major Cartel Leaders in Coahuila
description: This data details each of the events where major cartel leaders (Plaza level and above) were arrested in Coahuila, Mexico from 09/15/2011 to 12/14/2011.

properties.event summary: 10/12/2011: On Wednesday in Saltillo, Coahuila, Mexico, in accordance with operation "Escorpion," troops from the Mexican Army's 6th Military Zone arrested the head of Los Zetas in Coahuila, Nuevo Leon, and Tamaulipas and one of the most important leaders of the organization Carlos Oliva Castillo aka "La Rana." Authorities found Castillo's safe houses and made the arrest without gunfire. In response, members of Los Zetas launched attacks on army troops in Saltillo as an unsuccessful rescue attempt. He was transferred to the Federal Prosecutor and two rifles, two handguns, one package of marijuana weighing about five kilograms, two vehicles (one armored), various communication equipment, and computer equipment was seized during the arrest.
properties.event title: Mexican Army Captures Carlos Oliva Castillo in Saltillo, Mexico
properties.opinfo: Troops from the Mexican Army's 6th Military Zone were involved in the operation.

properties.security operations specs: The specific tactics used in the operation were not reported.
properties.event summary: 11/21/2011: On Monday, in Comarca Lagunera, Torreon, Coahuila, Mexico, Military personnel arrested Jorge Alejandro Cortes-Aguilera, also known as Comandante Castulo, and Santiago Maciel Rodriguez-Velazquez, also known as El Maciel. Cortes-Aguilera was a Los Zetas cell leader responsible for the criminal activities in Francisco I. Madero and in Torreon, Coahuila.  Rodriguez-Velazquez was a member of Los Zetas. Military personnel seized the following: one handgun, one grenade, 17 doses of cocaine, approximately 50 grams of marijuana, communication equipment, and one vehicle.
properties.event title: One Los Zetas Cell Leader and One Los Zetas Member Arrested  in Torreon, Coahuila, Mexico
properties.opinfo: Military personnel were involved with the operation.
